name: Personal Computing
description: Personal Computing technologies includes laptops, desktops, and workstations.

name: Portable Computing
description: Portable Computing technologies provide access to digital information, communication, and other services from easily-transportable endpoints.

name: Wearable Computing
description: Wearable Computing technologies are computing devices people wear or carry within their bodies.

name: Digital Signage
description: Digital Signage technologies control and manage display devices that present media and content.

name: End-User Manufacturing
description: End-User Manufacturing technologies enable individuals to fabricate or produce physical objects from digital models.

name: Endpoint Operating System
description: Endpoint Operating System technologies manage and control the hardware, resources, and other software on end-user computing devices.

name: End-User Utility Software
description: End-User Utility Software technologies are computer programs designed for users to perform commodity tasks.

name: End-User Remote Access
description: End-User Remote Access technologies enable authorised users to establish controlled connections to endpoints.

name: Printing & Scanning
description: Printing & Scanning technologies transform digital content into hard-copy output and convert physical documents into digital input.

name: Collaboration Platform
description: Collaboration Platform technologies provide shared-workspace features and functions that enable real-time co-creation and co-authoring.

name: Calendar & Meeting
description: Calendar & Meeting technologies assist with the management and scheduling of diaries and events for people and resources.

name: File Sharing Services
description: File Sharing Services technologies provide facilities that synchronise files between devices and enable file-sharing between users.

name: Email
description: Email technologies enable the asynchronous exchange of electronic messages and attachments.

name: Instant Messaging
description: Instant Messaging technologies facilitate real-time communication between individuals or groups.

name: Telephony
description: Telephony technologies enable interactive communication between physically-separated participants by transmitting sound and video.

name: Interactive Voice Response
description: Interactive Voice Response technologies enable automated telephone-based interactions with contact-centre customers.

name: Call Distribution
description: Call Distribution technologies facilitate multi-channel interactions between customers and contact centres by routing communications, managing queues, recording interactions, and providing analytics.

name: Media Production
description: Media Production technologies enable the generation, capture, manipulation, management, and broadcast of sounds and moving images.

name: Extended Reality
description: Extended Reality technologies enable the creation of simulated environments and digital elements that users can interact with.

name: Single Sign-On
description: Single Sign-On technologies provide individuals with the capability to authenticate once when accessing multiple protected systems.

name: Multi-Factor Authentication
description: Multi-Factor Authentication technologies require two or more verification factors to verify the identity of a user, process, or device.

name: Biometrics
description: Biometrics technologies can recognise individuals based upon biological and behavioural characteristics.

name: Access Management
description: Access Management technologies ensure resources, data, and functionality are available only to permitted users.

name: Privileged Access Management
description: Privileged Access Management technologies establish additional security controls over privileged accounts and elevated permissions.

name: Directory Services
description: Directory Services technologies store and provide services to access information about users and resources.

name: Federation Services
description: Federation Services technologies enable authorised individuals to access resources across trust domains using attributes asserted by an identity provider.

name: Secrets Management
description: Secrets Management technologies securely store, manage, and distribute secrets and credentials.

name: Certificate Management
description: Certificate Management technologies keep inventory of and lifecycle-manage digital certificates.

name: Decentralised Identity Services
description: Decentralised Identity Services technologies use distributed ledgers and cryptographic techniques that enable individuals to manage their digital identity information.

name: Document Management
description: Document Management technologies store, manage, and track electronic documents throughout their lifecycle.

name: Records Management
description: Records Management technologies facilitate the rules-based lifecycle management of digital and physical records.

name: Web Content Management
description: Web Content Management technologies lifecycle-manage, govern, and surface online content.

name: Digital Asset Management
description: Digital Asset Management technologies organise and store digital objects to facilitate their retrieval and sharing.

name: Knowledge Base
description: Knowledge Base technologies are used to collect and structure curated collections of information about a particular subject.

name: Enterprise Search
description: Enterprise Search technologies identify and enable data and information across multiple repositories to be found by and displayed to authorised users.

name: Business Intelligence
description: Business Intelligence technologies are used to create information products that communicate data analysis findings.

name: Data Analytics
description: Data Analytics technologies apply statistical techniques to interrogate, transform, and model raw data.

name: Visual Analytics
description: Visual Analytics technologies combine advanced analytics and interactive visualisation techniques to facilitate the exploration and communication of data.

name: Artificial Intelligence
description: Artificial Intelligence technologies are computing systems, algorithms, and logic-based techniques able to perform a variety of advanced functions and solve cognitive problems in ways that imitate the capabilities of the human mind.

name: Geographic Information System
description: Geographic Information System technologies manage, model, analyse, and display geographically-referenced data.

name: Relational Database
description: Relational Database technologies manage and provide access to data stored in related tabular structures.

name: Non-Relational Database
description: Non-Relational Database technologies store data data in non-tablular formats.

name: Data Warehouse
description: Data Warehouse technologies store and aggregate structured data from disparate sources.

name: Data Lake
description: Data Lake technologies are unstructured data repositories that store and secure a variety of data assets.

name: Messaging
description: Messaging technologies exchange data packets between systems.

name: Enterprise Service Bus
description: Enterprise Service Bus technologies connect and coordinate interactions between systems.

name: Data Movement
description: Data Movement technologies transport data from one place to another.

name: Data Virtualisation
description: Data Virtualisation technologies realise abstracted and integrated presentations of data accessed in-place from disparate sources.

name: Data Streaming
description: Data Streaming technologies transfer events continuously as they occur in data sources.

name: Managed File Transfer
description: Managed File Transfer technologies automate and orchestrate the migration and replication of file-based data.

name: Data Quality Management
description: Data Quality Management technologies assist with the identification and correction of data issues.

name: Master Data Management
description: Master Data Management technologies enable the identification and lifecycle management of an institution's official shared master data assets.

name: Metadata Management
description: Metadata Management technologies capture, manage, and facilitate the inspection of data that describe other data.

name: Reference Data Management
description: Reference Data Management technologies provide repositories and functions that enable the management and governance of reference data.

name: Data Loss Prevention
description: Data Loss Prevention technologies analyse and control the movement of data across networks.

name: Programming Language
description: Programming Language technologies are notation systems used to create instructions that cause compute environments to perform tasks.

name: Development Framework
description: Development Framework technologies provide resources and tools that builders and developers use to build and manage digital products.

name: Version Control
description: Version Control technologies manage changes to computer programs, documents, large web sites, or other collections of information

name: Continuous Integration & Continuous Delivery
description: Continuous Integration & Continuous Delivery technologies automate the build and validation of software and subsequently automate the release process.

name: Low-Code Application Platform
description: Low-Code Application Platform technologies enable software applications to be developed and run with minimal use of programming languages.

name: Software Functional Testing
description: Software Functional Testing technologies verify end-to-end functional behaviours and integration capabilities.

name: Software Non-Functional Testing
description: Software Non-Functional Testing technologies verify performance, usability, and compatibility.

name: Software Security Testing
description: Software Security Testing technologies analyse and test for security vulnerabilities.

name: Digital Accessibility
description: Digital Accessibility technologies help create, evaluate, and maintain digital content and functionality that can be used by individuals of all abilities.

name: Test Management
description: Test Management technologies facilitate the planning, execution, and monitoring of software testing activities.

name: Runtime Environment
description: Runtime Environment technologies provide places where digital solutions can be deployed and run.

name: Application Server
description: Application Server technologies provide middleware services and resources that enable the execution of business-logic software.

name: Web Server
description: Web Server technologies store, process, and deliver content using defined transfer protocols.

name: Content Delivery Network
description: Content Delivery Network technologies facilitate the availability of digital content through geographically-distributed server networks.

name: API Gateway
description: API Gateway technologies intermediate and protect client interactions with API endpoints.

name: API Management
description: API Management technologies are used to facilitate the end-to-end lifecycle management of APIs.

name: API Portal
description: API Portal technologies provide API consumers a place to discover, access, and learn about the API services published and offered by an API provider.

name: API Protection
description: API Protection technologies safeguard APIs from vulnerabilities, misuse, and unauthorised access.

name: Business Process Analysis
description: Business Process Analysis technologies model, inspect, and asses the performance of business processes.

name: Business Process Management
description: Business Process Management technologies support the modelling, monitoring, and optimisation of business processes.

name: Robotic Process Automation
description: Robotic Process Automation technologies are used to build, deploy, and manage software robots that emulate human interaction with digital systems.

name: Workflow Orchestration
description: Workflow Orchestration technologies enable the definition and automation of task sequences required to fulfil a business process.

name: Process Mining
description: Process Mining technologies examine machine-observable traces of business-process instances to analyse their performance.

name: Task Mining
description: Task Mining technologies observe and analyse the behaviour of users as they fulfil business-process tasks.

name: Server Operating System
description: Server Operating System technologies run, manage, monitor, and control applications, processes, and client devices.

name: Server Virtualisation
description: Server Virtualisation technologies create isolated virtual servers on physical infrastructure by abstracting the underlying hardware resources

name: Containerisation
description: Containerisation technologies package software applications and their dependencies together as self-contained portable units able to be deployed, executed, and managed in diverse environments.

name: File Storage
description: File Storage technologies organise data in a hierarchical format with files contained in directories within volumes.

name: Block Storage
description: Block Storage technologies organise data into fixed-sized blocks that are accessed through block-level protocols.

name: Object Storage
description: Object Storage technologies manage and organise data as distinct units in an unstructured format.

name: Data Backup & Recovery
description: Data Backup & Recovery technologies make periodic copies of system, configuration, and application data to facilitate subsequent recovery.

name: Data Archive
description: Data Archive technologies use rules to identify inactive data and move them to separate non-production storage.

name: Storage Virtualisation
description: Storage Virtualisation technologies abstract physical storage resources and present them as a centralised addressable endpoint.

name: Core Network
description: Core Network technologies route and switch network traffic between subnetworks.

name: Personal Area Network
description: Personal Area Network technologies are short-range networks that connect devices within close proximity.

name: Local Area Network
description: Local Area Network technologies connect computing devices in a limited geographical area.

name: Wide Area Network
description: Wide Area Network technologies connect computing devices over geographically-dispersed locations.

name: Network Address Services
description: Network Address Services technologies enable the assignment, resolution, management, and monitoring of IP addresses.

name: Load Balancer
description: Load Balancer technologies distribute workloads amongst multiple resources.

name: Network Virtualisation
description: Network Virtualisation technologies abstract physical network resources into manageable logical representations.

name: Network Hardware
description: Network Hardware technologies are physical devices used to build and operate wired and wireless communication networks.

name: Wireless
description: Wireless technologies provide computing devices with network connectivity using radio waves.

name: High-Performance Computing
description: High-Performance Computing technologies configure resources to maximise computational performance.

name: High-Throughput Computing
description: High-Throughput Computing technologies configure resources to maximise job-completion rate over extended periods.

name: Data Centre Management
description: Data Centre Management technologies manage the resource utilisation and control the environmental parameters of data centres

name: Operational Technology
description: Operational Technology may be used to represent the things, sensors, and devices of particular significance to an institution.

name: Instrumentation
description: Instrumentation may be used to represent the instrumentation and equipment of particular significance to an institution.

name: Security Information & Event Management
description: Security Information & Event Management technologies harvest and analyse security-related data from various sources.

name: Threat Detection & Response
description: Threat Detection & Response technologies enable the proactive identification and containment of potential cybersecurity threats.

name: User & Entity Behaviour Analytics
description: User & Entity Behaviour Analytics technologies monitor and analyse the behaviour patterns of users and devices to detect anomalous activities that may indicate security threats.

name: Vulnerability Assessment
description: Vulnerability Assessment technologies identify and categorise potential security weaknesses in systems and software.

name: Physical Security
description: Physical Security technologies deter, detect, and mitigate unauthorised access to premises and assets.

name: Secure Remote Access
description: Secure Remote Access technologies enable connection to endpoints for privileged system-level technology administration and observation.

name: Firewall
description: Firewall technologies control access to the network.

name: Distributed Denial of Service Mitigation
description: Distributed Denial of Service Mitigation technologies detect, analyse, and mitigate distributed denial-of-service attacks.

name: Antimalware
description: Antimalware technologies detect, prevent, and mitigate malicious software from systems.

name: Mobile Device Management
description: Mobile Device Management technologies enable the administration, monitoring, and securing of mobile devices.

name: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention
description: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention technologies monitor, detect, and prevent the unauthorised transmission of data from endpoint devices.

name: Configuration Management
description: Configuration Management technologies assist the process of maintaining systems in a desired state.

name: Remote Support
description: Remote Support technologies enable connection to endpoints for the administration of technical support.

name: Software Asset Management
description: Software Asset Management technologies facilitate the full-lifecycle tracking and oversight of an institution's software estate.

name: IT Cost Management
description: IT Cost Management technologies track and allocate the cost of technology systems and resources.

name: Monitoring & Alerting
description: Monitoring & Alerting technologies observe systems and generate notifications when pre-defined conditions are detected.

name: IT Asset Discovery
description: IT Asset Discovery technologies automate the location, identification, and indexing of an institution's technology estate.
